alert.note: Alert for Daniels (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 14 at 5:37PM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following counties, Daniels, Roosevelt, Sheridan and Valley. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 537 PM MDT, local law enforcement reported snowmelt in the advisory area. This is causing small stream flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
